content.question: If <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect of t, equals 6 times e to the negative 0.08 times, open parenthesis, t minus 5, close parenthesis, squared, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.08</mn><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, by how much does <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> change as <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> changes from <math alttext="t equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="t equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
